Class SimulationGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • SimulationGui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constants, Gui, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SimulationGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements Constants, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable, Gui
    This class provides a GUI displaying the queueing network used to simulate our system.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulationGui

        public SimulationGui(long memorySize,
             long maxCpuTime,
             long avgIoTime,
             long simulationLength,
             long avgArrivalInterval)
        Constructs and shows a new GUI.
        Parameters:
        memorySize - The size of the memory unit.
        maxCpuTime - The maximum time quant used by the Round Robin algorithm.
        avgIoTime - The average duration of I/O operations.
        simulationLength - The length of time to simulate.
        avgArrivalInterval - The average time between new process arrivals.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Method running as a separate thread when the "Start simulation" button is pressed. Starts the main simulation loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Listener method called when a button has been clicked.

      • setCpuActive

        public void setCpuActive(Process p)
        Controls which process is being shown as the process active in the CPU.
        Specified by:
        setCpuActive in interface Gui
        Parameters:
        p - The process that is currently active, or null if the CPU is idle.

      • setIoActive

        public void setIoActive(Process p)
        Controls which process is being shown as the process active in the I/O device.
        Specified by:
        setIoActive in interface Gui
        Parameters:
        p - The process that is currently active, or null if the I/O device is idle.

      • timePassed

        public void timePassed(long time)
        Lets the GUI know that a discrete amount of time has passed.
        Specified by:
        timePassed in interface Gui
        Parameters:
        time - The (simulated) time that has passed since the last call to this method.
